result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew C Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew C Jones is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew C Jones was found guilty of Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).
  • Matthew C Jones was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Each count concur. Count 1 will be dismissed if successful completion of probation.

miscConds.notes: $343 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.

Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with CH except by mail only for child placement or divorce matters. No physical discipline of any child.  Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward anyone. No unsupervised contact with NIJ unless approved by CH and therapist DD.
8/30/17 Crt orders the "Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with CH except by mail only for child placement or divorce matters" be amended to "Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward CH."

Completion of aggression/anger management treatment.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose. Def must continue all therapy. Def is to contact CH immediately by text if during visitation with NIJ tempers have escalated to the point where visitation should be stopped.
$343 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 2.

of right to seek postconviction relief.
Judgment of conviction prepared. Count 1 will be dismissed if successful completion of probation.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- No physical discipline of any child.
- No threats or acts of violence.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, with Christine J. except by email for child visitation purposes.
- Unsupervised contact with NIJ to be allowed with approval of Christine J. and David D. Therapist for NIJ and with def's regular particpation in NIJ's counseling sessions with David D. to work along with NIJ on an anger-management workbook.
- Def is to contact Christine J. immediately by text, if during a visitation with NIJ, he recognizes that tempers have escalated to the point where the vistation should be stopped.

Defendant in court with Attorney Peter A. Bartelt.  Paul L. Barnett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy J.T. duly sworn & testifies. Direct exam by ADA. Witness identifies defendant. Cross exam by attorney. Witness excused. Court finds probable cause and orders bindover. Arraignment to be held in trial branch. Oral motion to modify bail conditions is made by ADA. Defense objects to motion being heard today.
Preliminary hearing on June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Pat Bomhack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
